question: Section 202 07 (a)
sols_html:
Since we want to interpolate with cubic splines:

\[\begin{aligned} p_1(x) &= a_1x^3+b_1x^2+c_1x+d_1 \\ p_2(x) &= a_2(x-1)^3+b_2(x-1)^2+c_2(x-1)+d_2\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Since we want to interpolate with cubic splines:

:<math> \begin{align}
p_1(x) &= a_1x^3+b_1x^2+c_1x+d_1 \\
p_2(x) &= a_2(x-1)^3+b_2(x-1)^2+c_2(x-1)+d_2
\end{align} </math>
statement_html:
We want to interpolate through (0, 1), (1, 0), (2, 2) using cubic splines

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} p_1(x), & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\ p_2(x), & 1 \leq x \leq 2 \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

(a) Write down p1(x) and p2(x) in terms of unknown coefficients.
statement_raw:
We want to interpolate through ''(0, 1)'', ''(1, 0)'', ''(2, 2)'' using cubic splines

:<math>
f(x) = \begin{cases}
p_1(x), & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\
p_2(x), & 1 \leq x \leq 2
\end{cases}
</math>

'''(a)''' Write down ''p<sub>1</sub>(x)'' and ''p<sub>2</sub>(x)'' in terms of unknown coefficients.
